field_edited_text.value:
SECTION A: PENN STATION TO 29TH STREET

1. Gateway Park: Development of the two blocks between
Lafayette- and Lanvale Streets, from Charles Street to the
Fallsway, will create a southern gateway to the Jones Falls
Valley. As a second stage, this park can be extended east to
Guilford Ave., and serve as a major entrance to Downtown.

2. Commercial Potential — The Station: The air rights over the
Pennsylvania Railroad tracks can be developed with motels,
offices, distribution centers, residences, parking garages, and
a heliport. These can extend from North Avenue to Mt. Royal
Avenue and can incorporate a new station, and parcel post
and Railway Express depots as integral parts of the Plan.

3. Residential Potential — Mt. Royal Heights: The high ground
from Mt. Royal Avenue northeast to the Valley has a great
potential for high-rise residential and town house development
when the Plan is put into effect.

4. Landscaped Tracks: The City can acquire a right-to-plant in
railroad areas where land between the tracks is available for
screening planting. Views from the expressway would be
vastly improved, and railroad operations would not be im-
paired.

5. Druid House Restaurant: The southeast promontory of Druid
Lake commands an exciting view of the Valley to the north
and south and of the fascinating 28th-29th Street interchange.
The promontory can be leased by the City for development of
a fine restaurant. The Penn Station area — as seen from
above the Howard Street Bridge

6. Ma and Pa Pond: Realignment of the present Falls Road will — has an exciting commercial potential.
provide space for the pond and for landscape development.
The pond would be stocked with trout. Small boys would By o

come here to sail boats. A sculpture garden would be created ' =
along the edges. =t

7. Highway Link: The City’s Master Street Plan shows a pro-
posed major collector street following the old Maryland and
Pennsylvania Railroad right-of-way, up Wyman Park and
Stony Run from Sisson ,Stre'et north to Lake Avenue. This
highway would be tied into the Jones Falls Valley Road via
the existing tunnel under Sisson Street, thus affording a relief
route for Charles Street down to Maryland Avenue Bridge.

8. Round Falls: This beautiful water display is little known to
Baltimoreans, even though it is only a stone’s throw from
Falls Road. With selective cutting and planting, the view on
page 1 would be opened to travellers of the Jones Falls Valley.
This is part of the natural beauty of the Valley which can be
a treat to the eye of resident and motorist alike.
